dlgLine.text: [CRAIG ALIVE] So, <charname>... I know Craig talked to you about getting extra food for me. This isn't about that - well, it kind of is. I -okay. I have something to tell you.

dlgAnsw.text: [Glib] That you're in love with me? Oh, Karen, what will Craig say?
[Nice] Go on. I'm listening.
[Declare] Spit it out already, I don't have all day.

dlgLine.text: [CRAIG DEAD] <charname>, I... <Karen takes a deep breath and then lets it out.> I'm pregnant. I'm about three months along.
And I... I don't want this child. I had my doubts about it when Craig was alive, but now with him gone, I... I can't. I really, I really can't. And I need your help.

dlgAnsw.text: [Alternate] I'm sure you're desperate, but you should think about this more first.
[Sure] I will. You can count on my help.
[Not] I'm sorry, Karen, but the answer is no.

dlgLine.text: [ALTERNATE] I know... I know you mean well. And I'm sure you have the right reasons behind what you're asking. But I can't do this. I can't go every day after Craig's gone with his baby, the one I never wanted, knowing I have to struggle with it by myself. So I need to know if you'll help me.

dlgAnsw.text: [Sure] I can't say I'm happy about it, but... okay. I'll help.
[Not] I'm sorry, Karen, but the answer is no.

dlgLine.text: [NOT] <Karen attempts to collect herself.> I guess... that I have my answer then. Fine.

dlgAnsw.text: <Karen turns and walks hurriedly away before you can stop her.>

dlgLine.text: [SURE] Right. I... thank you. <Karen takes a deep breath to collect herself, then nods.> Okay. Here are the details.

dlgAnsw.text: [Okay] I'm listening.

dlgLine.text: [GLIB] Ha-ha, you're super hilarious, and no. No, this is a lot more complicated. As in, I rehearsed this multiple times before coming to talk to you, and things are still sticking in my throat. But here goes -

dlgAnsw.text: [Declare] Okay...

dlgLine.text: [NICE] Okay. <She takes several deep breaths, then looks exasperated with herself.> Dammit, I seriously did practice this more than a few times before coming here! Okay. Okay. Gonna just spit it out.

dlgAnsw.text: [Declare] Go ahead...

dlgLine.text: [DECLARE] I'm pregnant. <She pauses and nods.> Yep, didn't almost throw up when I said it that time. I'm pregnant. I'm about three months along, give or take a few weeks.

dlgAnsw.text: [Happy] Oh wow - congratulations!
[Wary] Okay, that's... yeah, that's complicated.
[Angry] Why the fuck didn't you tell me this earlier?!
[Nervous] Oh jeez. Does Craig know?
[Careful] And... how well are you dealing with this?

dlgLine.text: [HAPPY] Um, no, not congratulations. Not so much. It's a lot more complicated than that.

dlgAnsw.text: [Timing] Okay...

dlgLine.text: [WARY] <Karen gives an exhausted laugh that's half rueful and half like she's about to cry.> Yeah, that's an understatement.

dlgAnsw.text: [Timing] <Wait for her to continue.>

dlgLine.text: [ANGRY] Calm down. I didn't want to keep it secret this long - and obviously I won't be able to keep it under wraps for much longer. Nobody's going to believe I'm just "getting bloated" for months on end.

dlgAnsw.text: [Timing] Right. Fine. Go on.

dlgLine.text: [NERVOUS] Of course he does! Why do you think he's so insanely protective of me? I mean, yes, because he loves me, but he's been freaking out about the baby pretty much since I told him about it a month and a half or so ago.

dlgAnsw.text: [Timing] Okay, so, now what?

dlgLine.text: [CAREFUL] I'm... not really dealing with it well, to be honest. But I'm trying to fix that.

dlgAnsw.text: [Timing] How so?

dlgLine.text: [TIMING] Craig and I didn't want to say anything earlier because we were afraid you wouldn't take us in, but I, ah... <She pauses a moment.> I wasn't sure I wanted to have this baby before everything went to hell. Now... now I'm sure I don't want it.

dlgAnsw.text: [Craig] What's Craig's take on all this? Does he know how you feel?
[Okay] I understand. What can I do to help?
[Wary] What exactly are you saying?
[Negative] Karen - you're not seriously talking about getting rid of it, are you?

dlgLine.text: [CRAIG] Craig... he... he's excited about being a dad, but I don't think he knows what that means. I tried to talk about him about it multiple times, but he's acting like me having the baby is a foregone conclusion. He tries to listen, but - not really. <She looks at you evenly.> So - will you help me?

dlgAnsw.text: [Okay] I will. You can count on my help.
[Argue] I'm sure you're desperate, but you should think about this more first.
[No] I'm sorry, Karen, but the answer is no.

dlgLine.text: [WARY] What I'm saying is - I want an abortion. I didn't really want to be a mom before, and now I'm additionally scared of complications from childbirth, and trying to raise a baby when I'm barely surviving, and the strain it'll be on the group. <She sighs.> I don't want this. Will you help me?

dlgAnsw.text: [Craig] What's Craig's take on all this? Does he know how you feel?
[Argue] I'm sure you're desperate, but you should think about this more first.
[Okay] I will. You can count on my help.
[No] I'm sorry, Karen, but the answer is no.

dlgLine.text: [NEGATIVE] Yes, I am. I was weighing my options before, but once the virus hit, I just... it's too risky to have a baby when we're all barely getting by. And what about even just... the whole pregnancy, the birth, trying to rear it? I can't do that. And it's my body - it should be my choice.

dlgAnsw.text: [Craig] What's Craig's take on all this? Does he know how you feel?
[Argue] I'm sure you're desperate, but you should think about this more first.
[Okay] All right... I'm not wild about it, but I'll help.
[No] I'm sorry, Karen, but the answer is no.

dlgLine.text: [OKAY] So Texas isn't... wasn't... really big on abortions. But I know a doctor who performed them secretly in a clinic on the outskirts of Austin. Other places got picketers, but this one was more clandestine.

dlgAnsw.text: [Continue] Go on.

dlgLine.text: [CONTINUE] There's a device I need - an electric vacuum pump - and some other supplies. This place probably kept them in a single kit to make them easier to move around. The bad news is they probably kept it hidden and locked - you'll have to look for it.

dlgAnsw.text: [Confirm] I can do this. I'll try to get the kit as soon as I can.
[Backout] On second thought... this sounds too dangerous.

dlgLine.text: [CONFIRM] Thank you. I know this is a lot to ask, but I wouldn't do it if I weren't desperate. It means a great deal to me.

dlgAnsw.text: [END] You can count on me, Karen.

dlgLine.text: [BACKOUT] Are... are you serious? All that and you just - can't go through with it?

dlgAnsw.text: [Confirm] I... okay. I'll do it. You can't blame me for being nervous, is all.
[Shutdown] Nope, I'm out. I'm sorry.

dlgLine.text: [NO] <A shadow passes over Karen's face, and she looks down quickly, her voice soft.> Can I... can I at least ask why?

dlgAnsw.text: [Morals] Because abortion is murder, Karen!
[Regret] You might regret it. I don't want to be a party to that.
[Responsibility] This child is your responsibility, and you need to take care of it.
[Dangerous] It'd be too dangerous - it's a delicate procedure.
[Shutdown] No, you can't.

dlgLine.text: [ARGUE] <She looks at you skeptically, her expression stony.> So what exactly should I be thinking about that you think I've missed?

dlgAnsw.text: [Discord] This could tear Craig up - drive a wedge through the entire Shelter. We can protect you - but we need to be protected from ourselves too.
[Care] I'm a medical expert - if you're worried about pre and post-natal care, I promise I will keep you covered.
[Risk] I care about you, Karen, but sending people out to get equipment to help risks all of their lives. I can't risk many for the sake of one.
[Nothing] I... I guess I can't think of anything. I'm sorry.

dlgLine.text: [NOTHING] Well, now that we've established I've covered my bases, I'll make it plain: I need an abortion, and I need it soon, and I need help. Will you help me, yes or no?

dlgAnsw.text: [Okay] All right... I'm not wild about it, but I'll help.
[No] I'm sorry, Karen, but the answer is no.

dlgLine.text: [DISCORD] It'd - cause a problem in the Shelter? I suppose, but - look, it's - I... <She pauses a long moment.> All... all right. But on one condition: I don't go out in the field. My body will not be up to it. It's this, or I look for some other way.

dlgAnsw.text: [Keep] Done. No scavenging on the away team, I promise.
[Reconsider] On second thought... let's talk your option again.
[Nope] I can't promise that, Karen. No.

dlgLine.text: [CARE] I guess... having an in-house doctor is kind of a hard thing to argue against. <She pauses a long moment.> All... all right. But on one condition: I don't go out in the field. My body will not be up to it. It's this, or I look for some other way.

dlgAnsw.text: [Keep] Done. No scavenging on the away team, I promise.
[Reconsider] On second thought... let's talk your option again.
[Nope] I can't promise that, Karen. No.

dlgLine.text: [RISK] It's... I... <She lets out a long breath.> I know... I know triage. I know this is how you're supposed to handle things. I understand. <She pauses a long moment.> All... all right. But on one condition: I don't go out in the field. My body will not be up to it. It's this, or I look for some other way.

dlgAnsw.text: [Keep] Done. No scavenging on the away team, I promise.
[Reconsider] On second thought... let's talk your option again.
[Nope] I can't promise that, Karen. No.

dlgLine.text: [KEEP] Okay... it's a deal, then. I'll tell Craig what happened. Don't you dare fucking die, then - this baby's your responsibility too, now. If you're not careful I'll name them after you. And please, please find me some painkillers before I deliver, okay?

dlgAnsw.text: Understood. Thank you for listening to me. I hope you feel it's the right decision as much as I do.

dlgLine.text: [RECONSIDER] <She glares at you a moment.> There really only is the one option to this. And I'm not going to say that again. So let me give you the details.

dlgAnsw.text: [Okay] All right, I'm listening.

dlgLine.text: [NOPE] So... basically you tell me I need to have this baby because of reasons, but then you won't actually help me with the reality of what I'm going to need to make that happen? I can't believe you! <She begins to storm out of the room.>

dlgAnsw.text: [Reconsider] Wait! Let's talk options again.
[END] <Let her leave.>

dlgLine.text: [SHUTDOWN] <Karen stares at you a long moment, then walks out of the room.>

dlgAnsw.text: Right...

dlgLine.text: [MORALS] Abortion is - is murder? And what you do when you go out there and looters and gang members try to kill you - what's that, exactly? Self defense? When you break into a house and there's a man with a shotgun and you cut him down - what the fuck is that?

dlgAnsw.text: [MoralDefend] It's different, because -
[Shutdown] I don't care. Morals are morals, I won't help you kill a baby. The end.

dlgLine.text: [MORALDEFEND] Because you want to still feel good about yourself at the end of the day! And you're fine with me possibly dying in agony, forced to keep a child I don't want because you'd have to compromise something. Fuck you, and fuck the high horse you rode in on.

dlgAnsw.text: [END] <Karen storms out of the room.>

dlgLine.text: [DANGEROUS] No, actually, it isn't. I'm not in my second trimester just yet, the vast majority of abortions take place around this time, and if we get the right equipment, it could take less than five minutes. I researched this. I promise, I know what I'm doing.

dlgAnsw.text: [Okay] All right... I can't say I like this, Karen, but I'll trust you.
[Shutdown] No, Karen. The answer is still no.

dlgLine.text: [RESPONSIBILITY] Mine? No, I'm sorry, it's everybody's now, because I'll need medical care, and more food, and I can't go out in the field, and I need help taking care of it, and teaching it to not cry, and what happens if I die in childbirth?! <She takes a deep breath.> I'm trying to do right by all of us here.

dlgAnsw.text: [Argue] Okay, but there are other things to consider.
[Okay] Right, right. I can't say I like it, but I see your point. What's your plan?
[Shutdown] Your baby, your responsibility. End of discussion.

dlgLine.text: [REGRET] How can you even know what I'll regret? If I do, I'll keep it to myself, how about that? Regret will cost all of us less than me not being able to go out in the field, or dying in childbirth. Even if things went back to normal the day after I got the abortion, I'd still go on with my life.

dlgAnsw.text: [Argue] Okay, but there are other things to consider.
[Okay] Right, right. I can't say I like it, but I see your point. What's your plan?
[Shutdown] Look - I won't be a party to it. End of discussion.
